title: Define the Domain
text: A rational function is undefined when the denominator is equal to zero. So, let's start by setting the denominator equal to zero. Then we know every value other than that is a solution.
speech: A rational function is undefined when the denominator is equal to zero. So, let's start by setting the denominator equal to zero. Then we know every value other than that is a solution.
pacedSpeech: A rational function is undefined when the denominator is equal to zero. So, let's start by setting the denominator equal to zero. Then we know every value other than that is a solution.

title: Solving For the Domain

subHints.title: Solving For the Domain
subHints.text: For $$x^2-2x-15=0$$, factor the equation to get $$\left(x-5\right) \left(x+3\right)$$. Set these two expressions equal to zero to get that $$x=5$$ or $$x=-3$$.

speech: What is  x  for  x squared, minus 2 x minus 15 is equal to 0 ?
pacedSpeech: for   x squared, minus 2 x minus 15 is equal to 0

title: Answer
text: So, the function is defined for every value other than $$-3$$ and 5.The domain of the function is $$(-\infty,-3) \cup (-3,5) \cup (5,\infty)$$, with the circle brackets denoting the fact that $$-3$$ and $$5$$ are not valid solutions, and the U showing that values within the intervals are solutions.
speech: So, the function is defined for every value other than  minus, 3  and 5.The domain of the function is , the open interval from negative infinity to negative 3 union, parentheses, negative 3 comma 5,  union the open interval from 5 to infinity, , with the circle brackets denoting the fact that  negative 3  and  5  are not valid solutions, and the U showing that values within the intervals are solutions.
